content: The "Railroad Retirement Reform Act of 2000" prohibits the transfer of funds from the Social Security Equivalent Benefit Account to the Railroad Retirement Account or Trust Fund. This amendment ensures that the funds are only used for specific purposes outlined in the Act. The transition to full Social Security coverage of railroad employment is also addressed in the Act. The Railroad Retirement Reform Act of 2000 amends the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code to address the inclusion of railroad workers in the Social Security system before January 1, 2002. It also specifies the payment of FICA taxes and exempts service performed after 2001 from tier 1 taxes. The Railroad Retirement Reform Act of 2000 exempts service performed after 2001 from certain taxes under the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code. The plan must assure full funding for all new entrants' pension obligations using Employee Retirement Income Security Act funding standards. The Secretary of Labor must certify a multiemployer pension plan proposal by October 1, 2001, to provide defined benefit pension plans for new entrants hired after December 31, 2001. The plan must meet fiduciary and ERISA requirements and may include additional pension benefits for others. The multiemployer pension plan may transfer existing Railroad Retirement Act pension obligations, excluding social security equivalent benefits, with certification from the Railroad Retirement Board to the Secretary of Labor. Employers and employees covered by the plan can directly deposit pension fund contributions into the fund. Repeal of 4.3-cent motor fuel excise taxes on railroads and inland waterway transportation. The text chunk discusses amendments to taxes on trains under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, specifically removing references to diesel-powered trains and making conforming amendments to various sections. The text chunk introduces a new tax of 0.1 cent per gallon on diesel fuel used in trains, with exceptions for previously taxed fuel. Amendments are made to section 4082 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding taxes on fuel used in trains, including changes to sections 4041, 4083, 6421, and 6427.
